cards.name: Lovisa Coldeyes
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Mind vs. Might
cards.text: Each creature that's a Barbarian, a Warrior, or a Berserker gets +2/+2 and has haste.
cards.flavor: "A massacre? It is a mercy we grant them. This way they won't freeze to death."

rulings.text: Each creature with at least one of those subtypes gets +2/+2 from Lovisa Coldeyes' ability, regardless of how many of those subtypes it has. For example, a 3/3 Mistform Ultimus would become 5/5, not 9/9.

cards.originalText: Each creature that's a Barbarian, a Warrior, or a Berserker gets +2/+2 and has haste.

cards.name: Beacon of Destruction
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Mind vs. Might
cards.text: Beacon of Destruction deals 5 damage to any target. Shuffle Beacon of Destruction into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: The Great Furnace's blessing is a spectacular sight, but the best view comes at a high cost.

rulings.text: If a Beacon is countered or doesn't resolve, it's put into its owner's graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

cards.originalText: Beacon of Destruction deals 5 damage to target creature or player. Shuffle Beacon of Destruction into its owner's library.

cards.name: Boldwyr Intimidator
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Mind vs. Might
cards.text:
Cowards can't block Warriors.
{R}: Target creature becomes a Coward until end of turn.
{2}{R}: Target creature becomes a Warrior until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Now everyone knows what you are."

rulings.text: Coward is a new creature type.
Each of the activated abilities replaces all creature types the affected creature may have had.
Note that the exact wording of this card has changed since it was printed in the _Future Sight_(TM) set, but its functionality is the same.

cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Mind vs. Might
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Nature grows solutions to its problems.

rulings.text: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.name: Rubblebelt Raiders
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Mind vs. Might
cards.text: Whenever Rubblebelt Raiders attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it for each attacking creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"This city will perish, and the Gruul will cheer as the boar-god crushes the last bricks into dust."
—Nikya of the Old Ways

rulings.text: Count the number of attacking creatures you control when Rubblebelt Raiders's ability resolves, including Rubblebelt Raiders itself, to determine how many +1/+1 counters to put on it.

cards.originalText: Whenever Rubblebelt Raiders attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it for each attacking creature you control.

cards.name: Coat of Arms
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Mind vs. Might
cards.text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
cards.flavor: A banner for bonds of blood or belief.

rulings.text: If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted.
If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type.
Sharing multiple creature types doesn't give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

cards.originalText: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)

cards.originalText:

−2: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.name: Abundance
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: If you would draw a card, you may instead choose land or nonland and reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card of the chosen kind. Put that card into your hand and put all other cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: This replacement effect replaces the draw, so nothing that triggers on a draw will trigger.

If you use this on a multi-card draw, each replaced draw is handled separately. In other words, you reveal and then put on the bottom of the library for the first card, then do the same for the second, and so on. In a multi-card draw you do not have to choose how many of those draws will be replaced before you do any drawing or use of this card.
If no card of the chosen type is found before your library empties, you don't get a card, but you do get to order all the cards in your library any way you choose.

If your library is empty, Abundance can prevent you from losing the game for being unable to draw a card. If an effect or turn-based action would cause you to draw a card, you can replace that draw with Abundance's replacement effect. (It doesn't matter that you'd be unable to actually draw a card.) Since Abundance's effect has you put a card into your hand instead of drawing a card, you'll never be forced to draw a card with an empty library.

cards.originalText: If you would draw a card, you may instead choose land or nonland and reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card of the chosen kind. Put that card into your hand and put all other cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.text:
Flash
When Briarhorn enters the battlefield, target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Evoke {1}{G} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

rulings.text: If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters-the-battlefield trigger on the stack in either order. The one put on the stack last will resolve first.

Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)

cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Fertilid enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{G}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Fertilid: Target player searches their library for a basic land card, puts it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffles their library.

rulings.text: Although the targeted player doesn't need to find a basic land card if they don't want to, that player must shuffle their library.

cards.name: Gaea's Blessing
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Target player shuffles up to three target cards from their graveyard into their library.
Draw a card.
When Gaea's Blessing is put into your graveyard from your library, shuffle your graveyard into your library.

rulings.text: If Gaea's Blessing has no legal target cards in a graveyard, either because its targets became illegal or because you didn't choose any, the target player shuffles their library.
If an effect puts multiple cards from your library into your graveyard at once, put all of those cards there before Gaea's Blessing shuffles your graveyard into your library.

cards.originalText:
Target player shuffles up to three target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.
Draw a card.
When Gaea's Blessing is put into your graveyard from your library, shuffle your graveyard into your library.

rulings.text: You don't choose which creatures to tap until the ability resolves. You may tap Jaddi Lifestrider itself this way, assuming it's still on the battlefield untapped by this time.

cards.originalText: When Jaddi Lifestrider enters the battlefield, you may tap any number of untapped creatures you control. You gain 2 life for each creature tapped this way.

cards.name: Oran-Rief Hydra
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Trample
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Oran-Rief Hydra. If that land is a Forest, put two +1/+1 counters on Oran-Rief Hydra instead.

rulings.text: A landfall ability triggers whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control for any reason. It triggers whenever you play a land, as well as whenever a spell or ability puts a land onto the battlefield under your control.

When a land enters the battlefield under your control, each landfall ability of the permanents you control will trigger. You can put them on the stack in any order. The last ability you put on the stack will be the first one to resolve.

If the ability has an additional or replacement effect that depends on the land having a certain basic land type, the ability will check that land's type as the ability resolves. If, at that time, the land that entered the battlefield is no longer on the battlefield, use its types when it left the battlefield to determine what happens.

foreignNames.name: オラン＝リーフのハイドラ

cards.originalText:
Trample
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Oran-Rief Hydra. If that land is a Forest, put two +1/+1 counters on Oran-Rief Hydra instead.

cards.name: Saddleback Lagac
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: When Saddleback Lagac enters the battlefield, support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures.)
cards.flavor:
"A good lagac will carry you through thick and thin. A bad one . . . well, it's a tasty dinner."
—Raff Slugeater, goblin shortcutter

rulings.text: You can't put more than one +1/+1 counter on any one target using the support action.
Support can target a creature you don't control.
If a spell with support has other abilities that target creatures, those abilities and the support ability can target the same creature.

cards.originalText: When Saddleback Lagac enters the battlefield, support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures.)

cards.name: Scythe Leopard
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, Scythe Leopard gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Eldrazi are not the leopard's preferred prey, but they are better than no prey at all.

rulings.text: A landfall ability triggers whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control for any reason. It triggers whenever you play a land, as well as whenever a spell or ability puts a land onto the battlefield under your control.

When a land enters the battlefield under your control, each landfall ability of the permanents you control will trigger. You can put them on the stack in any order. The last ability you put on the stack will be the first one to resolve.

If the ability has an additional or replacement effect that depends on the land having a certain basic land type, the ability will check that land's type as the ability resolves. If, at that time, the land that entered the battlefield is no longer on the battlefield, use its types when it left the battlefield to determine what happens.

cards.originalText: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, Scythe Leopard gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

Kicker {1}{G} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} as you cast this spell.)
When Thicket Elemental enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, you may reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. If you do, put that card onto the battlefield and shuffle all other cards revealed this way into your library.

rulings.text: The "if you do" means "if you choose to reveal cards". You still shuffle if you have no creature card in your library.

cards.originalText:
Kicker {1}{G} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} as you cast this spell.)
When Thicket Elemental enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, you may reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. If you do, put that card onto the battlefield and shuffle all other cards revealed this way into your library.

cards.name: Thornweald Archer
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Their arrows are tipped with basilisk eyes and fletched with cockatrice feathers.

foreignNames.name: ソーンウィールドの射手

cards.originalText:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Vines of the Recluse
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+2 and gains reach until end of turn. Untap it. (A creature with reach can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: "The most elegant solutions are found in nature. You just have to know where to look."

rulings.text: You can target an untapped creature with Vines of the Recluse. It will still get the other bonuses.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +1/+2 and gains reach until end of turn. Untap it. (A creature with reach can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Walker of the Grove
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
When Walker of the Grove leaves the battlefield, create a 4/4 green Elemental creature token.
Evoke {4}{G} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

rulings.text: Evoke doesn't change the timing of when you can cast the creature that has it. If you could cast that creature spell only when you could cast a sorcery, the same is true for cast it with evoke.

If a creature spell cast with evoke changes controllers before it enters the battlefield, it will still be sacrificed when it enters the battlefield. Similarly, if a creature cast with evoke changes controllers after it enters the battlefield but before its sacrifice ability resolves, it will still be sacrificed. In both cases, the controller of the creature at the time it left the battlefield will control its leaves-the-battlefield ability.
When you cast a spell by paying its evoke cost, its mana cost doesn't change. You just pay the evoke cost instead.

Effects that cause you to pay more or less to cast a spell will cause you to pay that much more or less while casting it for its evoke cost, too. That's because they affect the total cost of the spell, not its mana cost.

Whether evoke's sacrifice ability triggers when the creature enters the battlefield depends on whether the spell's controller chose to pay the evoke cost, not whether they actually paid it (if it was reduced or otherwise altered by another ability, for example).
If you're casting a spell "without paying its mana cost," you can't use its evoke ability.

cards.originalText:
When Walker of the Grove leaves the battlefield, put a 4/4 green Elemental creature token onto the battlefield.
Evoke {4}{G} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

cards.name: Wood Elves
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Through the waves of Eldrazi attacks, the Murasan jungles seemed to regrow as soon as they were destroyed.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Woodborn Behemoth
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: As long as you control eight or more lands, Woodborn Behemoth gets +4/+4 and has trample. (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.flavor: It carries the hopes of Zendikar's embattled wilds on its mighty boughs.
cards.originalText: As long as you control eight or more lands, Woodborn Behemoth gets +4/+4 and has trample.

cards.name: Fertile Thicket
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Fertile Thicket enters the battlefield tapped.
When Fertile Thicket enters the battlefield, you may look at the top five cards of your library. If you do, reveal up to one basic land card from among them, then put that card on top of your library and the rest on the bottom in any order.
{T}: Add {G}.

rulings.text: You don't have to reveal a basic land card from among the five cards you look at, even if one is there. If you don't, you won't put a card on top of your library.

cards.originalText:
Fertile Thicket enters the battlefield tapped.
When Fertile Thicket enters the battlefield, you may look at the top five cards of your library. If you do, reveal up to one basic land card from among them, then put that card on top of your library and the rest on the bottom in any order.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Khalni Garden
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Khalni Garden enters the battlefield tapped.
When Khalni Garden enters the battlefield, create a 0/1 green Plant creature token.
{T}: Add {G}.
cards.originalText:
Khalni Garden enters the battlefield tapped.
When Khalni Garden enters the battlefield, put a 0/1 green Plant creature token onto the battlefield.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mosswort Bridge
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Hideaway (This land enters the battlefield tapped. When it does, look at the top four cards of your library, exile one face down, then put the rest on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {G}.
{G}, {T}: You may play the exiled card without paying its mana cost if creatures you control have total power 10 or greater.
cards.originalText:
Hideaway (This land enters the battlefield tapped. When it does, look at the top four cards of your library, exile one face down, then put the rest on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{G}, {T}: You may play the exiled card without paying its mana cost if creatures you control have total power 10 or greater.

cards.name: Treetop Village
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.originalText:
Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land.

cards.name: Ob Nixilis Reignited
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
+1: You draw a card and you lose 1 life.
−3: Destroy target creature.
−8: Target opponent gets an emblem with "Whenever a player draws a card, you lose 2 life."

rulings.text: The emblem created by Ob Nixilis Reignited's last ability is both owned and controlled by the target opponent. In a multiplayer game, if you own Ob Nixilis Reignited and use him to give one of your opponents an emblem, the emblem remains even if you leave the game.

foreignNames.name: 灯の再覚醒、オブ・ニクシリス

cards.originalText:
+1: You draw a card and you lose 1 life.
−3: Destroy target creature.
−8: Target opponent gets an emblem with "Whenever a player draws a card, you lose 2 life."

cards.name: Altar's Reap
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Draw two cards.
cards.flavor:
"I will secure my revenge on Zendikar one soul at a time."
—Ob Nixilis

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Altar's Reap, sacrifice a creature.
Draw two cards.

cards.name: Ambition's Cost
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"Conquering your first world is the hardest, after all. My power grew as I moved from world to world, taking anything that would make the next taking easier."
—Ob Nixilis
cards.originalText: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.

cards.name: Bala Ged Scorpion
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: When Bala Ged Scorpion enters the battlefield, you may destroy target creature with power 1 or less.
cards.flavor: Fast and lethal, with a penchant for the weak and infirm.

rulings.text: The power of the targeted creature is checked both as you target it and as the ability resolves.

cards.originalText: When Bala Ged Scorpion enters the battlefield, you may destroy target creature with power 1 or less.

cards.name: Blistergrub
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
When Blistergrub dies, each opponent loses 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"Avoid anything that scuttles, scrabbles, or shambles."
—Opar, veteran guide
cards.originalText:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
When Blistergrub dies, each opponent loses 2 life.

cards.name: Cadaver Imp
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Flying
When Cadaver Imp enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: The mouth must be pried open before rigor mortis sets in. Otherwise the returning soul can find no ingress.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Cadaver Imp enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Carrier Thrall
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: When Carrier Thrall dies, create a 1/1 colorless Eldrazi Scion creature token. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C}."
cards.flavor:
"Later we will mourn those we have lost. First we must end their suffering."
—Drana, Kalastria bloodchief

rulings.text: Eldrazi Scions are similar to Eldrazi Spawn, seen in the Zendikar block. Note that Eldrazi Scions are 1/1, not 0/1.
Eldrazi and Scion are each separate creature types. Anything that affects Eldrazi will affect these tokens, for example.
Sacrificing an Eldrazi Scion creature token to add {C} to your mana pool is a mana ability. It doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.

Some instants and sorceries that create Eldrazi Scions require targets. If all targets for such a spell have become illegal by the time that spell tries to resolve, the spell won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't get any Eldrazi Scions.

cards.originalText: When Carrier Thrall dies, put a 1/1 colorless Eldrazi Scion creature token onto the battlefield. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C} to your mana pool."

cards.name: Demon's Grasp
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Take what solace you can in the knowledge that you will not be here to witness Zendikar's demise."
—Ob Nixilis
cards.originalText: Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn.

cards.name: Desecration Demon
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each combat, any opponent may sacrifice a creature. If a player does, tap Desecration Demon and put a +1/+1 counter on it.

rulings.text: Players won't know which player or planeswalker Desecration Demon will attack, if any, when deciding whether to sacrifice a creature.

Each opponent in turn order may choose to sacrifice a creature, even if an opponent already chose to sacrifice a creature that combat. Desecration Demon will have a maximum of one +1/+1 counter put on it each combat, no matter how many creatures were sacrificed.

cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of each combat, any opponent may sacrifice a creature. If a player does, tap Desecration Demon and put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Despoiler of Souls
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Despoiler of Souls can't block.
{B}{B}, Exile two other creature cards from your graveyard: Return Despoiler of Souls from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Rats and vultures devour. It desecrates.
cards.originalText:
Despoiler of Souls can't block.
{B}{B}, Exile two other creature cards from your graveyard: Return Despoiler of Souls from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Disfigure
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Brave scar or unfortunate tale? It all depends on your pain threshold."
cards.originalText: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Doom Blade
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavor:
"One little word was all it took. The world shook as I said it. The doom of Zendikar was here at last."
—Ob Nixilis
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.name: Fetid Imp
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Fetid Imp gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.originalText:
Flying
{B}: Fetid Imp gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Foul Imp
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Flying
When Foul Imp enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: The imp, unaware of its own odor, paused to catch its breath . . . and promptly died.

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 2 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Foul Imp enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.

cards.name: Giant Scorpion
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Its sting hurts, but death is strangely painless.
cards.originalText: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Grim Discovery
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Choose one or both —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return target land card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Few among the living understand just how much of their world is shaped by the ruins of the dead.
cards.originalText:
Choose one or both —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return target land card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Hideous End
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. Its controller loses 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"A little dark magic won't stop me. The worse the curse, the better the prize."
—Radavi, Joraga relic hunter, last words

rulings.text: If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Hideous End resolves, the entire spell doesn't resolve. No one loses life.

cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature. Its controller loses 2 life.

cards.name: Indulgent Tormentor
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card unless target opponent sacrifices a creature or pays 3 life.
cards.flavor: The promise of anguish is payment enough for services rendered.

rulings.text: The opponent chooses whether they sacrifice a creature, pays 3 life, or allows you to draw a card. That player can't make an impossible choice, such as sacrificing a creature while they control no creatures.

If there are no legal targets to choose, perhaps because all your opponents have hexproof, the ability is removed from the stack with no effect. You won't draw a card. This is also true if the target opponent becomes an illegal target in response to the ability.

cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card unless target opponent sacrifices a creature or pays 3 life.

cards.name: Innocent Blood
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: Each player sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor: Zombies mourn for the living and celebrate those who will soon be given the gift of death.

rulings.text: You can cast Innocent Blood even if some (or all) players control no creatures. Those players are simply unaffected.

cards.originalText: Each player sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Mire's Toll
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: Target player reveals a number of cards from their hand equal to the number of Swamps you control. You choose one of them. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: As the bridge snapped, Berko was sure he heard the swamp laughing at him.

rulings.text: If the number of Swamps you control exceeds the number of cards in the targeted player's hand, that player reveals all the cards in their hand.

cards.originalText: Target player reveals a number of cards from his or her hand equal to the number of Swamps you control. You choose one of them. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Pestilence Demon
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Flying
{B}: Pestilence Demon deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: "I have schemed too long to be supplanted by dead gods. If I cannot have this world, no one can."

rulings.text: Pestilence Demon deals 1 damage to itself, as well as to each other creature and each player.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{B}: Pestilence Demon deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Priest of the Blood Rite
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
When Priest of the Blood Rite enters the battlefield, create a 5/5 black Demon creature token with flying.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: Some will sacrifice everything for but a taste of power.
cards.originalText:
When Priest of the Blood Rite enters the battlefield, put a 5/5 black Demon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life.

cards.name: Quest for the Gravelord
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Whenever a creature dies, you may put a quest counter on Quest for the Gravelord.
Remove three quest counters from Quest for the Gravelord and sacrifice it: Create a 5/5 black Zombie Giant creature token.

rulings.text: Quest for the Gravelord's first ability triggers regardless of who controlled the creature and whose graveyard it was put into.

cards.originalText:
Whenever a creature dies, you may put a quest counter on Quest for the Gravelord.
Remove three quest counters from Quest for the Gravelord and sacrifice it: Put a 5/5 black Zombie Giant creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Renegade Demon
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.flavor: Confront it at your own peril, for it will confront you for its own amusement.

cards.name: Shadows of the Past
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Whenever a creature dies, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
{4}{B}: Each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life. Activate this ability only if there are four or more creature cards in your graveyard.

rulings.text: Once you legally activate the last ability, it doesn't matter how many creature cards are in your graveyard as it resolves.

cards.originalText:
Whenever a creature dies, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
{4}{B}: Each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life. Activate this ability only if there are four or more creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Smallpox
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: Each player loses 1 life, discards a card, sacrifices a creature, then sacrifices a land.
cards.flavor: Take away a few things, and a rebellion may ensue. Take away everything, and the oppression will be accepted as fate.

rulings.text: Each player loses 1 life. Then, starting with the active player and proceeding in turn order, each player chooses a card to discard (normally without seeing what other players have chosen) and all discards happen simultaneously. Then, starting with the active player and proceeding in turn order, each player chooses a creature to sacrifice (this time players can see what other players have chosen) and all sacrifices happen simultaneously. Then the process that happened for creatures is repeated for lands.

cards.originalText: Each player loses 1 life, discards a card, sacrifices a creature, then sacrifices a land.

cards.name: Squelching Leeches
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: Squelching Leeches's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: Setting foot in their muck is an open invitation.

rulings.text: Squelching Leeches's power and toughness will change as the number of Swamps you control changes. Its ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just those named Swamp.
The ability that defines Squelching Leeches's power and toughness works in all zones, not just the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Squelching Leeches's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

cards.name: Tendrils of Corruption
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: Darkness doesn't always send its minions to do its dirty work.

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number of Swamps you control, not the amount of damage Tendrils of Corruption deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Tendrils of Corruption would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't gain any life.

cards.originalText: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.

cards.name: Unhallowed Pact
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor: Agreements with demons seldom end at the grave.

rulings.text: The card will return to the battlefield under your control only if it's still in the graveyard when Unhallowed Pact's ability resolves. If it's not (perhaps because an ability like undying has already returned it to the battlefield), nothing happens.
If Unhallowed Pact is enchanting a token creature, that creature can't return to the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Leechridden Swamp
cards.setName: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
cards.text:
({T}: Add {B}.)
Leechridden Swamp enters the battlefield tapped.
{B}, {T}: Each opponent loses 1 life. Activate this ability only if you control two or more black permanents.
cards.originalText:
({T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.)
Leechridden Swamp enters the battlefield tapped.
{B}, {T}: Each opponent loses 1 life. Activate this ability only if you control two or more black permanents.
